1.notes: SCIE 113, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150

Students without one of Biology 11 or Biology 12 must take BIOL_V 111 before taking BIOL_V 112 or 121. Students without Chemistry 12 must take CHEM_V_V 100, CHEM_V 110, or CHEM_V 111 before taking BIOL_V 112.

Students who do not have B.C. High School Chemistry 12 (or its equivalent) must write the UBC Chemistry Basic Skills Test and may be required to take CHEM_V 100. If a student elects to take CHEM_V 110 or 120, and/or CHEM_V 130, the student will have an extra 1 or 2 elective credits available to them.

Students who do not have B.C. High School Chemistry 12 (or its equivalent) must write the UBC Chemistry Basic Skills Test and may be required to take CHEM_V 100. If a student elects to take CHEM_V 110 or 120, and/or CHEM_V 130, the student will have an extra 1 or 2 elective credits available to them.

Students taking more than 3 credits of first year MATH_V should count these extra credits as electives and reduce the total number of elective credits accordingly. MATH_V 110 may substitute for any of the specified differential calculus courses listed by reducing the total number of elective credits by 3.
Students without Physics 12 must take PHYS_V 100 before taking PHYS_V 106 or PHYS_V 117 or PHYS_V 131.

2.notes: Elective credits together with required courses must fulfill the Faculty of Science’s: a) Foundational Requirement ; b) Laboratory Science Requirement ; c) Science Breadth Requirement ; d) Science and Arts Requirements ; e) Upper-level Requirement ; f) General Degree Requirements .

3.notes: For Cellular and Molecular Emphasis, take BIOL_V 371, 372. For Behavioural and Cognitive Emphasis, take PSYC_V 370, 371.

Elective credits together with required courses must fulfill the Faculty of Science’s: a) Foundational Requirement ; b) Laboratory Science Requirement ; c) Science Breadth Requirement ; d) Science and Arts Requirements ; e) Upper-level Requirement ; f) General Degree Requirements .
